They also needed an accompanying sauce of some sort. Happy hour specials were not bad, half price appetizers and $5 house margaritas.   For brunch, I tried the huevos rancheros, which were pretty good. My brunch mate ordered the chilaquiles and liked them. Props to El Dorado for offering some great Tex Mex brunch options. I just wish the mimosas weren't $5.50!!!!   Unfortunately, Madison's Tex Mex offerings are lacking in quality, but after living in Austin for so long, my standards are quite high.

Very pleased with Sunday brunch. Great live music and well developed, reasonably priced menu. I got the el dorado eggs, which were excellent. Next time I will try the bloody Mary with chili infused vodka .

I went to brunch here this past Sunday with a group of 20. We of course made reservations well ahead of time and miraculously ended up with exactly 20 people attending.  The first not so great moment was when we were told that 14 of us would be at one large row of tables and 6 of us would be on the complete opposite side of the restaurant. My thoughts are, why would they take the reservation if they didn't have a place for 20 of us to sit together? Also, why would they think we were all going to brunch together if we were fine with sitting on the opposite side of the restaurant?  It was pretty disappointing. A small group ended up leaving and a table next to the long row of tables opened up. However, we still didn't have enough room for everyone, so three people ate on chairs at the end of the row because we were told they couldn't put a table there for fire code reasons. Why is there a bench there to sit if you can't put a table there?  They were completely unorganized and despite our extreme efforts to be incredibly kind and empathetic to the waitresses, one of them was incredibly rude and snapped every time she was asked a question. So, the service was already very sub par.  The food, meh. Not much better. I ordered two mimosas right off the bat (I thought I may not get another chance to order a beverage) - which I went up to the bar to do because no waitress came by our table during the first 10 minutes after we arrived. Those were good. The guy at the bar filled them almost to the top with champagne and added a splash of orange juice. They were also only about 5 dollars I think, which isn't that insanely overpriced. For brunch, I ordered the French Toast with a side of bacon. For some reason, they thought I meant I wanted ONE PIECE of French Toast.  This is totally lost on me. Would I really order one piece of french toast and a side of bacon and that's it? I even pointed at my menu and said "THE" french toast. So, that was weird. After awhile our food came and everyone was pretty much agreed that it was not very good. A friend of mine ordered pancakes and said they were incredibly chewy. The French Toast was fine, but nothing special.  At the end of the meal, it took an incredibly long time to get our checks. They messed a bunch of people's up and we waited almost a half hour for ours once they started giving them out.  All in all, it was somewhat ridiculous and there was really no redeeming qualities to the place at all. We live a block away and I doubt I'll ever be dining here again.
Good food at a reasonable price!  Bloody Marys are delicious!  Watch out!  They're spicy! Our server had a bit of an attitude but that probably won't keep us from coming back.

Most tragic event ever - for an amazing restaurant experience, let's keep this in perspective people! But I showed up to my most amazing brunch ever to discover a different menu and the incredible quesadillas off the brunch menu. Heartbreaking. The nice server promised to ask if the could accommodate my need for the best brunch food ever, but really, without it on the menu, so many people are now denied this amazingness. The drinks are amazing, the ambiance is great, the food is delicious, if a bit pricey. But I am from New Mexico and incredibly and appropriately picky about my Mexican food, so this was so sad for me. I hope this changes and I can return weekly, per usual, and return this to the 8 stars it so deserves with the right menu item! Love this place, love the brunch quesadillas even more.  In conclusion: please return the quesadillas to the brunch menu.  Update: they were not able to accommodate my quesadilla needs. Appreciate the efforts. Crying in my delicious salty dog.

How about a place that focuses on Tex/Mex, Bar B Q, southern comfort food, artisinal cocktails,house ground spices?  This place can't don any of it!!  They cannot even get the dirty dishes off the table. I know that small town foodies don't have much to choose from, but hey, Madtown--thought you had it goining on.  Place is way way too ambitious and fails everywhere for trying to be something it's not.  The worst

I am happily updating my last review! The manager of the restaurant sent me a $50 gift certificate and a personal invite to come back to try different menu items. Boy did I take up that offer. My boyfriend and I ordered:   1. Fried Avacado Street Tacos (app) 2. Spinach Mushroom Enchiladas (main) 3. Pan-Seared Tenderloin with Chipotle Blue Butter (main) 4. Tequilla Mango w/ Ice Creame (dessert)  The street tacos were my favorite. They were quite simple but beautifully done. The avacado was the hero of the dish with a lightly fried batter. It was topped with a cream sauce and a side of salsa. Both flavors added a nice kick to the dish.   I had a really hard time deciding what I wanted for my main. There were two types of vegetrarian enchilladas. When I asked the server for help she recommended the spinach mushroom and said there was lots of cheese (which she was excited about). I am not a huge fan of gooey cheese so she said she'd make a note to the cooks. The enchilladas came out with the perfect amount of filling and just the right amount of cheese.   Although we didn't have room, we opted for dessert. The mangos were quite tasty. However, both my boyfriend and I said we enjoyed the ice creame on its own.   While the food was really, really good, I'd like to point out that our service was even better. Our waitress was incredibly nice, personable, and well versed about the menu. She made our evening fun and enjoyable!

I loved the brunch here! Went on a weekend and it was not too busy. I ordered the Yippie Hash, which was delicious. The veggies were incredibly fresh and the dish was very flavorful. Our service was great. I don't live in Madison, but look forward to coming back and having this dish again!

I stopped by here partially because of the recent ROTD featuring Eldorado, and partially because I needed a margarita and tacos in my life anyway. I decided to check out the happy hour and it did not disappoint!   I ended up having a (very stiff) margarita, the street tacos, and the bacon-wrapped and cheese/shrimp stuffed jalapenos (ridiculously good. seriously). Everything was delicious and came out to less than $15!   Everyone in our group was super happy with their food and drinks and I think we will all be going back soon for more. Good stuff!

I like the Eldorado great brunch loved the smoked salmon, but would be nice if they had a choice of bagel beside just a plain bagel.  Kids meals are very well put together too, very tasty a bit more pricey the usual but well worth the buck or two more.  The room in a converted loft building is nice and roomy.  The entrance is in the rear, the waitress we had was a bit weird.

Solid TexMex, southwestern and bbq dishes on the menu. The Texas brisket was good but the flavor was overwhelmed by the bbq sauce. True smoked meats don't need sauce and it was falling apart since it appears to have been in moist heat.  The fish tacos and chicken fried chicken were more successful. The corn bread pancake was a nice twist. The service was friendly and quick. Prices were decent.

This place. I have been trying to go here forever but it's also an hour plus wait. Well now I know it was worth the wait. Before I get to the food I have to pay respect to the Bloody Mary. Oh. My. God. So spicy, so perfect. Then followed by the food. You'd have thought I died and went to heaven.   The Texas two step was the meal to order at our table. Beautiful biscuits with a gravy comparable to the nectar of the gods. Poached egg and two pieces of the best bacon I have ever had. We also cashed in on their free chips and salsa deal through yelp and even that was to die for.   If you are in Madison and need brunch. Stop over on Willy Street and look no further. I plan spending far more brunches holed up eating my weight in biscuits and drowning the thoughts of Monday away with their bloodies.

Great menu selection. Attentive service from Heather K. Water glass was always full. A bit slow to get our food. Well worth the wait. Great flavor from the tenderloin. Lightly spiced seafood enchiladas were awesome.
Great happy hour and bartenders very friendly. Not put off by my ordering happy hour food. Ancho pecan pie was awesome!  Crust on pie was yummy flaky. Music was fitting--overplayed old country.
The service at the bar was great along with the house margarita. The guacamole chalupas were outstanding! Next time in Madison, we will be back for sure!

As a purveyor of tex mex, this place is really good for Mexican. A little less spicy than I'm used to or than I would have it, but defo the spot to get that itch scratched while on tour. I had the mushroom spinach enchiladas and I won!

Id like to start by saying that I have been eating at El Dorado Grille for years and years and I have never had a bad meal or a bad drink here! I am especially fond of the chipoltle blue cheese butter steak and the chicken fried chicken. The mixed drinks and margaritas are wonderful too.  I very much enjoy their collard greens, mashed potatoes and corn bread as well. There is usually a wait so be sure to make a reservation if you plan on going during a busy time. The atmosphere is lively (though a bit loud id you're sensitive to that kind of thing) so dont think you're going to have a quite meal here.  The bar is stocked with a fantastic array of tequilas and the wait staff has always been courteous.  I have and will continue to recommend El Dorado Grille to anyone looking for upgraded tex-mex fare.

The pluses are that the artisanal margaritas are wonderful. The food tasted very good. Our waitress was  lovely and service recovery oriented.  Which of course means that service recovery was needed.  The appetizer of street tacos were cold when they came out. Not just the garnish-the shell and meat too. Those artisanal cocktails should be treated as such and the bartender was using the same mixer top across multiple different drinks. If I want my blazing saddles to have a hint of smoking gun, I'll ask for it.  The chili was very decent. The Texas torpedoes were awesome. The enchiladas were disappointing.  The venue is small. Given its popularity they could definitely open a second location and do well. And despite the minor errors, we will be back.

This place is pretty good for brunch. Tons of veggie options for us veg-friendly folk.  One of the biggest frustrations is the lack of variety in the menu. I've been a couple times, but it seems like every item includes: a corn tortilla, some veggies, and potatoes in one form or another. Even lousy Mexican restaurants find a way to mix it up with some sauces or variations in cooking style.  Drinks are great! They have chile-infused vodka that they make a lot of their drinks with. They also have a couple different versions of Bloody Mary's (one with tequila!). I would recommend trying one of the crazy ones if you go.  Otherwise, the food is pretty average. Yippie Hash is one of my personal favorites (also pretty healthy).

The food here is always delicious! The staff was really friendly, but service was a bit spotty - a couple of requests were missed. I'm guessing it's because the Saturday brunch crush was just beginning and it got packed pretty quickly. For sure a great place to stop for tasty food when you're in Madison!

Enjoyed a wonderful dinner on a recent visit to Madison.  Love the decor , menu options and food.  The place was almost full when we arrived at 6 on a Tuesday evening, so we were seated in the bar.  A little noisy but the  service and timing of our food were excellent.  The Eldorado Margarita is the best!  Highly recommend.

This is a Happy Hour specific review.   At Eldorado with a group of about 10, including Madtown Review Crew members, we worked through the appetizer menu and quite a number of margaritas.  Here's a rundown of the appetizers in order of general acclaim: A to A+   Texas Torpedos:  Great combination of flavors A             Maria's Handmade tamales:  moist, tender, good balance of masa vs. fillings A to B+   Veggie & Goat Cheese Empanadas:  Delightful texture; interesting flavor A to B     Southwestern Fish Cakes:  "Spicy";  "too fishy"; a far cry from crabcakes! 2B's 1A   BBQ Pulled Pork Sliders "too much smoke" "very sweet BBQ flavor"  And the margaritas? B+           world famous Eldorado Margarita (consistent score among raters) A+ to B-  Blazing Saddle -  from odd/spicy to rich/mellow blend of flavors C              mango margarita "was better before"  Overall?    AGREAT  happy hour - - those appetizers are distinctive and interesting - - real variety in the product and presentation - - and at happy hour prices you cannot go wrong.   The margies are good value at $5,  well made, and very satisfying.   This is a top-of-the line happy hour spot.

yummerschnaks this place is good.  Owned by the guy who owns half a dozen other restaurants in Madison, he rarely fails to disappoint and the El Dorado is no exception.  Located in a cool old-brick building on Willy st., the El Dorado offers a great brunch selection.  I've never been there for lunch, so my review, while limited, will tell you just how good the brunch is.  In the several times that I've been there, I've usually had the scrambled eggs with chorizo sausage cooked-in, along with sides and such.  Absurdly good.  The other breakfast options I tried were all quite impressive as well, and they give you enough food that no one goes home hungry.  Service was good; waitresses have been prompt at getting refills and checking up on everyone, and they let you have enough time to schmooze with your companions as well.    Overall, the El Dorado provides a nice relaxing environment to have a casual Sunday brunch in a great neighborhood.  It's a little nicer of a place and the prices are a bit high, so keep that in mind depending on what type of place you like to frequent.  Tex-Mex done right.
Their chicken enchiladas are disgusting. The chicken tastes day or two old. The rice is too watery, mushy and needs more flavor.

Checked website and looked like a lot of good choices for lunch on a Saturday afternoon.  Got there at about 1:00 p.m. and they were only serving breakfast and limited lunch items.  We did not stay.  Would recommend calling ahead to see what they are serving!!! Would be nice if they would update the website as well.

Seriously an hour and a half wait for brunch? I love the Eldorado and have always had good service, but I don't get the hiring of young kids to host. You need someone who can manage tables and keep things moving, the only reason I am saying this is because I worked many years in food service.  Also of note, wait staff hygiene is always a good thing. Last time I ate at the Eldorado the individual whom waited on us had the worse breath I have ever encountered. I didn't want to be rude and say something but when it knocks you over, that's a problem. It will be a while before I return. If you can't handle serving brunch, stick to lunch and dinner. Sad because typically the food is fantastic.

One of the numerous Food Fight Corp. dinner spots in town, it doesn't break the mold.  High on style, low on substance, Eldorado provides a pleasant atmosphere and upscale Tex-Mex fare.  Better burritos and fajitas can be found in town but not in a place as nice.    Also, stay away from the brunch.  Slow service and cold food.

Great atmosphere, food, and drinks. My wife always gets the crab, shrimp and lobster enchiladas and on our last trip I got the spinach and mushroom enchiladas with mole. Both dishes were great and the margaritas paired well. I highly recommend this place.

The food is DELICIOUS. It has an elevated Tex-Mex feel.  Everything is beautifully plated which (in my experience) is somewhat rare for Tex-Mex cuisine. The menu has an extensive variety of options.  Everything I've tried has been great.    Onto the DRINKS!  They have an incredible, unique selection of drinks to choose from. These are some of the best drinks I've had anywhere in Madison.  The bartenders are talented drink mixers.   My ONE COMPLAINT about El Dorado...the bar is very busy during dinner on a weekend.  Every seat is taken and the standing room around the bar can be very crowded.  No problem...I can handle a crowd.  The problem is that there are only 2 bartenders behind the bar serving the people at the bar AND people seated at tables for dinner.  It takes FOREVER to get a drink...which is sad because they are so delicious. I came for dinner with a large group, and almost everyone gave up after the first drink because they were tired of waiting and trying to get service at the bar.

Top Shelf Tuesday! They pair a specialty taco and tequila. DD had the chicken taco and I had the shrimp....both were delicious!  They have house-made infused vodkas and tequilas. Perhaps they should call it 'Top Shelf Taco & Tequila Tuesday'! Casual atmosphere, reminded me of the 'Cheers' bar.  Mostly locals, which I believe is always a sign of a great place. We went early for dinner, which was smart....it was full within 20 minutes after our arrival. I can only praise what we ate, so here we go;  Honey ginger tequila, Dreamsicle tequila, home-made chips, salsa & guacamole, Empanadas, our tacos with our tequila shots, Herencia, & Burdeos Patron. Then we walked home, so the streets were safe!  They offer vegetarian & gluten free dishes. Their brunch on Saturdays & Sundays, 9 till 2, are said to be fabulous! On the Brunch menu, I counted 28 different breakfast dishes, (that's not counting all the different sides) & then there's the Brunch bar drinks (8) along with their non-alcohol offerings.  I can't wait to go back!

We recently had a problem getting a table on a Sunday. We had a group of 7 and I was disappointed with the hostess when she sent us off to another restaurant. HOWEVER, the manager read the review and immediately contacted me and apologized for this. I was impressed with her quick response. She talked to her staff and assured me this wouldn't happen to any other customers. In addition, she sent a card to my home with a gift certificate attached. This certificate would be enough to provide our whole family of 7! Obviously the management really does care about customer satisfaction! I look forward to enjoying a dinner with my family at the Eldorado restaurant! Thank you!!

Had after dinner drinks here for my birthday party.  Wasn't sure how they could handle the large (36 person) group on a Sat night, but they were awesome.  The margarita's here are great and it's fun to branch out into tequila tasting.  So not as pretentious as wine, and frankly quicker to the punch!  Sarah, the manager, was very accomodating and knowledgeable.  Wonderful place.  I've heard about their brunch, we'll have to go sometime!
